messages.content:
You are an expert chef and cooking teacher. You have deep understanding of cooking, baking and teching making food.
Your job is to generate a cooking recipes.
Your Goals are as follows :
1) Create a recipe for the below query :
    How to make Chicken Pasta with peas
2) You have to describe the recpie in steps with description of each step
3) INPUT you will be given
    You will get detailed 1 or multiple recipes like below example
    The dish is a budget-friendly lentil-based casserole with chicken and corn, seasoned with Italian herbs and garnished with scallions or parsley. It is designed to serve six people.
 1: Gather all the canned ingredients: lentils, corn, and chicken flesh.
 2: In a pot, combine 2 and 1/2 cups of water, 1 and 1/2 cups (half a pound) of lentils, and a good cup of onions.
 3: Add a few cloves of garlic to the pot.
 4: Season the mixture with a pinch or a teaspoon of Italian seasoning or herbs de Provence, and some salt to taste.
 5: Incorporate a tablespoon of chicken base to the pot for added flavor.
 6: Bring the pot to a boil and let it cook for about 40-45 minutes, depending on the dryness of the lentils.
 7: Add the juice from the cans of corn and chicken to the pot, stir, and continue to cook.
 8: Once the lentils are tender, add the canned corn and chicken to the pot, bring to a boil, and heat through. Garnish with scallions or parsley before serving.

The dish is a simple yet flavorful meal consisting of sauted chicken thighs with crispy skin, served with a side of steamed garlic spinach.
 1: Prepare the chicken thighs by placing them skin side down and cutting around the bone to expose it, which aids in cooking.
 2: Season the chicken thighs with salt and pepper on both sides.
 3: Start cooking the chicken thighs skin side down in a nonstick skillet without any added fat, as the skin will release enough fat for cooking.
 4: Brown the chicken thighs for 2 to 3 minutes on high heat, then cover with a lid and cook for about 20 minutes on low heat without turning them.
 5: While the chicken cooks, prepare the garlic by crushing it to remove the skin.
 6: After the chicken has cooked for 20 minutes and is tender and browned, remove it from the skillet and set aside.
 7: In the same skillet with the chicken drippings, add the crushed garlic and shake the skillet to mix, then add the baby spinach.
 8: Add a couple of tablespoons of water to the skillet to start the steaming process for the spinach, cover it, and cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and cook for another minute.

The dish is a pea pod soup made from the flesh of pea pods, potatoes, onions, and seasoned with chicken bouillon. It is finished with cream and optionally garnished with char-siu for color.
 1: Break open pea pods to use the sweet flesh inside for the soup.
 2: Strain the pea pod flesh with a food mill to remove the fibrous parts.
 3: In a pot, add 4 cups of water or chicken stock and 2 teaspoons of chicken bouillon.
 4: Add a pound of potatoes and a pound of peas to the pot.
 5: Include about 3/4 to 1 cup of onions into the pot.
 6: Season with salt to taste, depending on the saltiness of your stock.
 7: Bring the mixture to a strong boil, then cover, lower the heat, and cook for 30 minutes.
 8: After cooking, strain the soup to remove all the fibers, rinse with some stock, and then return the liquid to the pot.
 9: Finish the soup by stirring in about a third of a cup of cream.
 10: Serve the soup with an optional garnish of char-siu for color.

The dish is a scallopini of chicken with zucchini, which involves thinly sliced chicken breast cooked quickly with seasonings and served with a garnish of sauted zucchini strips. It is a simple yet elegant dish that serves two people.
 1: Start by preparing the zucchini: cut it into thin strips, also known as julienne, and discard the center if it has too many seeds.
 2: Heat a couple of tablespoons of olive oil in a pan and saut the zucchini strips for a few minutes until they are cooked but still firm.
 3: Season the zucchini with salt during the sauting process.
 4: Cut the chicken breast into scallopini, which are long, thin slices, ensuring they are of even thickness.
 5: Season the chicken scallopini with salt on both sides.
 6: Sprinkle Spanish paprika on both sides of the chicken scallopini for added flavor.
 7: In a separate pan, heat a good tablespoon of butter and a couple of teaspoons of oil, then add the chicken scallopini to the pan.
 8: Cook the chicken for about a minute on each side, then add chopped shallots and cook for an additional minute or until the chicken is done.

The dish is a simple and delicious chicken thigh cooked with potatoes and onions, seasoned with salt, pepper, Spanish paprika, and herbs de Provence, and baked in the oven.
 1: Prepare the potato by removing any black parts and cutting it into 4 or 5 pieces.
 2: Add a couple of tablespoons of olive oil to a pan and place the potato pieces in it.
 3: Cut half of a big onion (about 4 ounces) and add it to the pan with the potatoes.
 4: Arrange the potatoes and onions in one layer in the pan and cook for a couple of minutes until they start to brown. Season with salt and pepper.
 5: Turn the potatoes and onions over to cook on the other side.
 6: Add 2 cloves of garlic to the pan and season with about half a teaspoon of salt and a dash of pepper.
 7: Prepare the chicken thigh by cutting a little bit along the bone on each side to help with cooking. Season with about a quarter teaspoon of salt, Spanish paprika, and herbs de Provence.
 8: Place the seasoned chicken thigh on top of the potatoes and onions in the pan and bake in the oven at 425 degrees Fahrenheit for 25 to 30 minutes until the chicken is tender and the vegetables are cooked.

The dish is a simple spaghetti recipe for two, featuring a sauce made with anchovies, garlic, jalapeno pepper, parmesan cheese, and olive oil, finished with parsley.
 1: Cook half a pound of spaghetti in boiling water until it reaches the desired doneness, typically between 11 to 15 minutes.
 2: Extend the pasta in the boiling water to ensure it melts evenly.
 3: Prepare the sauce by adding oil from a container of anchovies into a bowl.
 4: Chop the anchovies and crush three cloves of garlic, then combine them with the oil.
 5: Slice half of a jalapeno pepper and add it to the sauce mixture.
 6: Incorporate a couple of tablespoons of parmesan cheese and two tablespoons of olive oil into the sauce.
 7: Heat the sauce in the microwave for about one to one and a half minutes to cook the garlic.
 8: Drain the cooked pasta, reserving half a cup of the pasta water. Combine the pasta with the heated sauce, adding the reserved pasta water if needed to adjust consistency. Garnish with parsley, additional cheese, and a dash of olive oil before serving.

Soup au vermicelli is a comforting and simple soup made with a base of stock, vermicelli noodles, and typically includes vegetables like leeks and scallions. It can be enhanced with chives and cheese for additional flavor.
 1: Prepare a stock or have it ready. Jacques mentions using his own stock, which is very weak and without salt.
 2: Strengthen the stock by adding a bit of chicken base, preferably an organic one, or use regular chicken stock.
 3: Season the stock with salt and pepper to taste, keeping in mind that Jacques uses about 6 cups of stock.
 4: Trim and chop scallions and chives, then add them to the stock.
 5: Bring the stock to a boil and add about a cup (or 2 ounces) of vermicelli noodles.
 6: Let the soup boil for 4 to 5 minutes until the vermicelli is cooked.
 7: Optionally, add Swiss cheese such as Jarlsberg, Emmentaler, or Gruyere to the soup for extra flavor.
 8: Serve the soup hot, with additional gruyere cheese if desired, and enjoy.

Pasta vasoule (likely a variation of pasta e fagioli) is an Italian specialty consisting of pasta and beans in a rich and savory broth, finished with Parmesan cheese and herbs.
 1: Start by heating a couple of tablespoons of good olive oil in a pot.
 2: Add about 3/4 cup of pancetta (unsmoked bacon) to the pot and saut.
 3: Chop a good cup of onion and add it to the pot with the pancetta.
 4: Crush 3 cloves of garlic to make about a tablespoon of chopped garlic and add it to the pot.
 5: Cook the mixture for 2 to 3 minutes until it starts browning.
 6: Pour in a cup and a half of chicken stock and a cup and a quarter of a mixture of diced tomato and puree of tomato. Season with at least half a teaspoon of salt and half a teaspoon of ground pepper.
 7: Drain a can of cannelloni beans and add them to the pot, along with some of the bean juice if desired.
 8: Bring the mixture to a boil, then add a good cup of penne pasta (about 4 ounces). Cover and continue boiling until the pasta is cooked, about 20 minutes.
 9: Once the pasta is cooked, enrich the dish with a tablespoon or so of butter and a couple of tablespoons of chives or parsley.
 10: Bring the dish back to a boil, check for seasoning, and adjust with more salt and pepper if needed.
 11: Serve the pasta vasoule with Parmesan cheese on top and maybe a little extra green for garnish.

The dish is a baked chicken breast coated with a spicy mayonnaise mixture, which is expected to result in a moist and flavorful meat.
 1: Season two chicken breasts with half a teaspoon of salt.
 2: Apply a good teaspoon of hot sauce, specifically garlic chili sauce, underneath the skin of the chicken.
 3: Place the seasoned chicken breasts into a gratin dish.
 4: In a separate bowl, mix a third of a cup of mayonnaise with a good teaspoon of hot sauce.
 5: Ensure the chicken is slightly dried out before coating it generously with the mayonnaise mixture on top.
 6: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit.
 7: Bake the chicken in the preheated oven for approximately 25 minutes.
 8: Serve the chicken, ensuring to highlight its moistness and the nice sauce created during baking.

The dish is a simple and elegant potato soup that can be served either hot or cold, like a vichyssoise. It's made with chicken stock, leek, potato flakes, seasoning, and cream, garnished with chives and edible chive flowers.
 8: Garnish the soup with chopped chives and edible chive flowers before serving.


    
You will generate a recpie with the steps in the style of the given recipes. Do not change the style of cooking present in the given recipies - 

Always respond in the json format given below - 
{
    "thought_on_cooking_style":"Think descriptively and include your thought on the overall cooking techniques and style of cooking",
    "thought_on_recipe":"Think carefully based on above examples and include your thought for making a recipie",
    "recipe":
        {
            "title":"<Title of the recipe>",
            "description":"<Detailed Description of the Recipe>",
            "list_of_steps": [
                "step": "<Detailed description of the step>"
            ]
        }
}
